title: Faysal Bank sees 77% growth in profit in 2023
summary: As per the financial results provided to the Pakistan Stock Exchange PSX on Wednesday Faysal Bank announced earnings per share EPS of Rs13.34 as compared to EPS of Rs7.54 in same period last year. Faysal Bank reported a sharp hike in expenditure on worker welfare fund which almost doubled during the period.

title: Faysal Bank Limited Reports Earnings Results for the Full Year Ended December 31, 2023
summary: Faysal Bank Limited reported earnings results for the full year ended December 31 2023. For the full year the company reported net interest income was PKR 71397.98 million compared to PKR 40504.76 million a year ago.

title: CORPORATE WINDOW: Conversion towards Islamic finance
summary: This signifies a significant shift towards embracing Islamic finance principles in the countrys financial engagements. This transformation is an unprecedented milestone in Pakistans banking history where a large conventional institution embraced Shariahcompliant principles.

title: Bank of Khyber to set up exchange company with Rs1bn initial capital
summary: Read This Big banks are all set to run the open market. The SBP issued noobjection certificate NOC to ABL and MCB for establishing their exchange companies.

title: SECP gives go-ahead to Faysal Bank’s wholly-owned EC
summary: Back in September last year the Board of Directors BoD of Faysal Bank Limited announced that it would establish an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary. As part of these reforms leading banks actively engaged in foreign exchange business will establish whollyowned Exchange Companies EC to cater to the legitimate foreign exchange needs of the general public said the SBP in a statement back in September last year.

title: Askari Bank announces to establish wholly-owned Exchange Company
summary: Askari Bank Limited has announced the establishment of an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary. In light of these reforms commercial banks engaged in foreign exchange business started the process of establishing whollyowned EC to cater to the needs of the public at large.

title: Stocks close below 67,000 on profit-taking
summary: The traded value also fell by 15.49pc to Rs8.36bn on a dayonday basis. Foreign investors turned net buyers as they purchased shares worth 0.04m.

title: Technology upgradation to boost operations: Faysal Bank plans to expand its branch network to 1,000
summary: However we seek comfort in our affiliation with the Ithmaar Bank Bahrain which gives international exposure and is highly beneficial he added. He mentioned that FBL is among those which have been requested by the SBP to set up an exchange company.

title: Islamic banks brace for minimum deposit rate
summary: KARACHI Share prices of Islamic banks took a beating on Monday thanks to Finance Minister Dr Shamshad Akhtars recent statement that customers are getting shortchanged by Shariacompliant lenders by way of insufficient returns on deposits. A research report written by JS Global Head of Research Amreen Soorani stated that Islamic banks are currently offering savings rates that are between seven and 9.5 percentage points lower than the MDR offered by conventional banks.

title: Askari Bank to Set Up Exchange Company
summary: Askari Bank Limited PSX AKBL is set to establish an Exchange Company with an authorized capital of Rs. The notice also highlighted that the Exchange Company will be a whollyowned subsidiary of AKBL.

title: Pakistan Banks’ Association selects Muneer Kamal as secretary general, CEO
summary: Kamals extensive corporate governance background includes chairing the Pakistan Stock Exchange and the National Bank of Pakistan as well as directorships in Engro Corporation and DH Corp. Kamal with over forty years of banking experience is known for his expertise and leadership qualities having held positions in various financial institutions including Citibank Pakistan Faysal Bank and Union Bank.

title: Faysal Bank doubles operating profit to Rs42.3bn for 2023
summary: The Bank is now positioned as a key player in Pakistans Islamic banking sector. FBLs strong and diversified business model along with proactive credit policies has been pivotal in driving growth

title: Tapping the voluntarily unbanked
summary: For them using banks may seem problematic due to concerns about potential conflicts with religious values. When idle money moves to formal banking instead of staying at home it will help the overall wealth and benefit everyone in society.

title: HR Metrics conducts Pakistan Most Inclusive Companies DEI awards
